title: The impact of a cashless society on your data
text:
Famously, it wasn’t until 1994 that British businesses came to see and capitalise on the value of data. Your data. When you shopped and how often? What you bought and why? 1994 was the date of a celebrated presentation in the Tesco boardroom made by Edwina Dunn and her husband Clive Humby.

Their company, Dunnhumby, had been brought in to help Tesco launch its Clubcard. A swipe of the Clubcard entitled customers to special offers and discounts. But there was a quid-pro-quo: the supermarket learned exactly what its customers were up to.
